text:
I too am curious, what limit are you referring to Thomas? What was the error you saw that you're getting that from?

My guess based on the limited information provided is that you possibly just hit the 10 CRM object calls, not a file size limit. Which usually if you hit that it means you're not being efficient with how you're grabbing the data for your page. 

<https://legal.HubSpot.com/HubSpot-product-and-services-catalog#:~:text=invocations%20per%20CMS%20page%20load|https://legal.HubSpot.com/HubSpot-product-and-services-catalog#:~:text=invocations%20per%20CMS%20page%20load>
Nah there's a 10meg limit per page HubSpot has. If the data is more than 10 megs it'll error out. It's happened across several accounts to us. If I catch the error again I'll take a photo
would not be surprised if HubSpots compiler is trying to take both lines and merge them in the first example
Andreas caught it, was missing a = lol
Could you please answer the question as to what you are doing that you need to render 10mb of HTML so we can help you troubleshoot?
was trying to catch the error to post it straight up but can't find it; basically if the renderer has more than 10 megs of data it'll error out and the page won't render
I'm asking what are you trying to do?
what is the use-case that you need to print that much HTML
its a portal so it's handling _alot_ of data that was unpaginated
this also happened with Inbounds agenda page in the past
sorry i'm just in looking to see whats wrong I didn't create the page

Can you paginate, or filter the data? or use graphQL to grab just the data you actually need?

Because regardless of limits, 10mb is still a lot of data, and if most of it never even gets looked at by the user it'd be a waste of loading time. We could change it instead to be hybrid, getting some data server side some data client side to make it more efficient if the user actually decides they need more of the data.
yeah thats what I changed it too and that seemed to "fix" it
depends on your usage of 10mb tbh, opengl you can quickly zap up that 10mb limit
Well in this scenario are you actually grabbing opengl or webgl data?
nah, I didnt see your edit after so I was just giving an example lol
this page had like 4 queries to the CRM for something like....~2000 data and the page couldn't handle it I guess but yeah moving to graphql it handled it better
So currently the issue has not popped back up since converting over to graphQL and using graphQL to limit the data ingested to the page?
ehhhhhh kinda... theres a module that isn't popping up either which makes me wonder if you can only do 1 graphql query _per_ page and not _per_module?
but not receiving any errors so its more of a weird thing then a sure thing

Modules and templates separately get graphQL queries. I will look through our docs but I don't recall a per-page limit, though to be honest if we don't have one that could change, if folks try to abuse that.
yeah I don't remember running into that either which makes me think it might be something else but still not sure. appreciate you looking into it tho

hmm have you tried using
``` {% if item.hs_lastmodifieddate|int %} ```
? Maybe that works better than checking if not null?
let me try!

So after reviewing I see no mention of a limit when you have multiple queries but each individual query has complexity based limits and a max record limit (for CRM it looks like 500, for HubDB there is no limit)
oh wow no limit for HubDB?
thats good to know sweet
thanks Jon
well the HubDB no limit thing kind of has an artificial limit because HubDB itself has a row limit
ohh right
isnÂ´t there also "truthy"? maybe that works?
no go lol
tried everything on this too <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/operators-and-expression-tests>
oh well its just a warning, thanks for your help andreas
of course
